properties.areaDesc: Transylvania; Haywood; Anderson; Hart; Southern Jackson; Franklin; Greater Greenville; Greater Pickens; Oconee Mountains; Rabun; Northern Jackson; Greenville Mountains; Habersham; Greater Oconee; Pickens Mountains; Stephens; Graham; Macon; Swain
properties.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued February 11 at 3:20AM EST until February 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...HEAVY RAINFALL AND POTENTIAL FLASH FLOODING THROUGH TODAY...

.A slow-moving frontal boundary will continue to bring moderate
to heavy rainfall to the southwest North Carolina mountains,
parts of northeast Georgia, and far western Upstate South
Carolina today. With the ground saturated from heavy rainfall
last week, and many streams running at elevated levels, additional
flash flooding is expected to redevelop within the watch area
today. In addition, some main stem river flooding is likely to
develop within and close to the watch area.

The Flash Flood Watch continues for

* portions of northeast Georgia, western North Carolina, and
upstate South Carolina, including the following areas, in
northeast Georgia, Franklin, Habersham, Hart, Rabun, and
Stephens. In western North Carolina, Graham, Haywood, Macon,
Northern Jackson, Southern Jackson, Swain, and Transylvania.
In upstate South Carolina, Anderson, Greater Greenville,
Greater Oconee, Greater Pickens, Greenville Mountains, Oconee
Mountains, and Pickens Mountains.

* through this evening

* Additional rainfall amounts through today are expected to range
from 1 to 3 inches across the Piedmont, with locally higher
amounts expected. In light of the saturated ground and elevated
stream flows resulting from last week's heavy rainfall, this
rainfall will likely result in development of localized flash
flooding, some of which could be significant.

* Rapid rises above bankfull on streams and creeks may occur,
along with the threat of flooded roadways. Flooding is also
likely to re-develop on main stem rivers in and close to the
watch area.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead
to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation.

You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action
should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING
